hints.text: I was meant to be temporary - my survival was never guaranteed.
hints.explanationText: The Eiffel Tower was built for the 1889 World's Fair and was originally planned to be dismantled after 20 years.

hints.text: For a long time, my height mattered more for signals than for sight.
hints.explanationText: The tower's height made it useful for radio and broadcast transmissions, which helped justify keeping it standing.

hints.text: Wind passes through me instead of pushing against me.
hints.explanationText: Its open lattice design allows wind to pass through, reducing pressure and increasing stability.

hints.text: When I appeared in 1889, I was the tallest structure humans had ever made.
hints.explanationText: At the time of its completion, it surpassed all previous man-made structures in height.

hints.text: I stand on the Champ de Mars in Paris.
hints.explanationText: This precisely identifies the Eiffel Tower's location.

solutionExplanation: All clues point to the Eiffel Tower: a structure built as a temporary experiment, later preserved for its height and engineering design, and located on the Champ de Mars in Paris.
